channel.title: Posts on Honalee
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Honalee

item.title: 三件小事
item.description:
1

以下两个链接是关于一些Data4Good的项目： http://blog.datalook.io/openimpact-project-shortlist/ http://datalook.io/datanerds/ 有趣的点在于，这些项目提供了可供其他城市或者机构快速复制的可能性。

2

New York City似乎一直作为Urban Informatics的一个案例，Chicago看起来也做的很不错，而且这个开源的github组织还挺值得花些时间看看。

3

打算参加一下这个呀，warm-up https://www.drivendata.org/competitions/2/warm-up-predict-blood-donations/data/

item.title: 最近的歌单
item.description:
Guardian of the Galaxy 2 “Guardians Inferno” The Sneepers featuring David Hasselhoff

This comedic original, co-written by Gunn and score composer Tyler Bates, is meant as a sort of Guardians take on Meco’s disco Star Wars theme. Gunn is particularly proud of a line that rhymes “procyon lotor” – i.e., “racoon,” as in Bradley Cooper’s Rocket – with “motor.” They recruited David Hasselhoff as vocalist largely because he’s supposed to be one of Peter Quill’s childhood heroes.

item.title: Hugo It
item.description:
Firstly, need to install hugo correctly.

Initialization

Then, start to build your website.

$ hugo new site jackypaper
$ cd jackypaper
$ tree -a

.
|-- archetypes
|-- config.toml
|-- content
|-- data
|-- layouts
|-- static
`-- themes

6 directories, 1 file

Add Content

$ hugo new <SECTIONNAME>/<FILENAME>.<FORMAT>
$ hugo new post/hugo.md

content
└── post
    └── hugo.md

1 directory, 1 file

+++
title = "hugo"
draft = true
date = "2017-04-11T00:02:49-04:00"
+++

Add Theme

I choose hemingway2 as my page theme.

$ cd theme
$ git clone https://github.com/beli3ver/hemingway2.git

Update config.toml

baseurl = "https://example.com"
languageCode = "en"
title = "Hemingway2"
theme = "hemingway2"
copyright = "© <a href=\"https://github.com/beli3ver\">Malte Kiefer</a> 2016"
disqusShortname = "shortname"
googleAnalytics = ""
description = "Your personal description"
keywords = ["keyword1", "keyword2"]

[taxonomies]
tag = "tags"
category = "categories"

[params]

[params.highlight]
style = "github"
languages = ["go", "dockerfile"]

[[params.social]]
url = "https://github.com/beli3ver"
fa_icon = "fa-github"

[[params.social]]
url = "https://gitlab.com/beli3ver"
fa_icon = "fa-gitlab"

[[params.social]]
url = "https://twitter.com/malkie16"
fa_icon = "fa-twitter"

[[params.social]]
url = "https://telegram.me/beli3ver"
fa_icon = "fa-telegram"

[[params.social]]
url = "/index.xml"
fa_icon = "fa-rss"

Start the Server

$ cd ..
$ hugo server --theme=hemingway2 --buildDrafts

Make posts public

$ hugo undraft content/post/good-to-great.md
$ hugo server --theme=hemingway2

Generate website

% In config.coml
baseURL = "https://<your GitHub username>.github.io/jackypaper/"
[or]
baseURL = "https://jackypaper.github.io/"

$ hugo --theme=hemingway2

Deploy bookshelf on GitHub pages

# root folder
$ git init
$ echo "/public/" >> .gitignore
$ echo "/themes/" >> .gitignore
$ git add --all
$ git commit -m "Initial commit"

$ cd public

# If necessary, Please check:
$ git config user.name
$ git config user.name jackypaper

$ git init
$ git remote add origin https://github.com/jackypaper/jackypaper.github.io.git

If necessary, for subdomain

$ git checkout -b gh-pages
Switched to a new branch 'gh-pages'

Add all the files (within jackypaper/public) to the index, commit them, and push the changes to GitHub.

$ git add --all
$ git commit -m "new commit"
$ git push -f origin master
[or, for subdomin]
$ git push -f origin 'gh-pages'

Regenerate page

$ (cd ..; hugo --theme=hemingway2)

$ cd public
$ git add --all
$ git commit -m "<some change message>"
$ git push -f origin master <or 'gh-pages'>
